definition: to extend the period/to reschedule (a debt)
to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: You will reach a brand new plateau that has enormous potential.
sentences.chinese: 你将达到一个的新的拥有大量潜力的平稳发展期。

sentences.english: You are requested to renew you offer for another couple of weeks.
sentences.chinese: 请将你方报盘再展期两星期。

sentences.english: “The passport office is pretty expeditious when it comes to handling renewals,” Teddy said.
sentences.chinese: 在办理展期方面，护照办人员是很迅速的。

sentences.english: The Chinese communications industry is under fast development in the last decade.
sentences.chinese: 近十年来，中国通信业处于高速发展期。

sentences.english: The photonic crystal is developing vigorously, and its future will be filled with challenge and hope.
sentences.chinese: 光子晶体正处于蓬勃发展期，其未来充满挑战和希望。

sentences.english: What the hell is a negative growth period?
sentences.chinese: 那这该死的消极发展期又是什么呢？

sentences.english: The exposition will last until April 25 next year.
sentences.chinese: 花博会的展期将持续至明年4月25日。

definition: to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition
closing date (of contract)/maturity (of an investment bond)
to put on display/to be on show/to exhibit
the end of fixed period in office/expiration of a term
solstice/the winter solstice 冬至 and summer solstice 夏至
relative position of exhibition booth/allocated floor space for display stall/allotted exhibit area
